name: Couscous Primavera
author: Chef John
summary: This is a healthy, delicious, and easy side dish that takes about 10 minutes to make. I'm borrowing the name from Pasta Primavera which, like this recipe, takes advantage of fresh, seasonal, green produce.
ingredients: 1 bunch asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1/4-inch pieces
1 cup shelled fresh or thawed frozen peas
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine couscous, green onion, jalapeno, olive oil, cumin, cayenne pepper, and black pepper in a large bowl; stir until olive oil is completely incorporated
Bring vegetable stock, asparagus, and peas to a boil in a saucepan over high heat
Pour stock, asparagus, and peas over couscous mixture; shake bowl to settle couscous into liquid
Cover and let stand for 10 minutes
Fluff with a fork, then stir in mint and season with salt and pepper to taste
